refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: The b10-auth daemon provides the BIND 10 authoritative DNS server. Normally it is started by the b10-init8 process.

This daemon communicates with other BIND 10 components over a b10-msgq8 C-Channel connection. If this connection is not established, b10-auth will exit.
It receives its configurations from b10-cfgmgr8.

listitem.para: Enable verbose logging mode. This enables logging of diagnostic messages at the maximum debug level.

refsect1.title: CONFIGURATION AND COMMANDS
refsect1.para: database_file defines the path to the SQLite3 zone file when using the sqlite datasource. The default is /usr/local/var/bind10/zone.sqlite3.

datasources configures data sources. The list items include: type to define the required data source type (such as memory); class to optionally select the class (it defaults to IN); and zones to define the file path name, origin (default domain), and optional filetype. By default, zones is empty. For the in-memory data source (i.e., the type is memory), the optional filetype configuration item for zones can be specified so the in-memory zone data can be built from another data source that is based on a database backend (in practice with current implementation, it would be an SQLite3 database file for the SQLite3 data source). See the BIND 10 Guide for configuration details.
Only the IN class is supported at this time. By default, the memory data source is disabled. Also, currently the zone file must be canonical such as generated by named-compilezone -D.

listen_on is a list of addresses and ports for b10-auth to listen on. The list items are the address string and port number. By default, b10-auth listens on port 53 on the IPv6 (::) and IPv4 (0.0.0.0) wildcard addresses.

tcp_recv_timeout is the timeout used on incoming TCP connections, in milliseconds. If the query is not sent within this time, the connection is closed. Setting this to 0 will disable TCP timeouts completely. The default is 5000 (five seconds).
getstats tells b10-auth to report its defined statistics data in JSON format. It will not report about unused counters. This is used by the b10-stats8 daemon. (The sendstats command is deprecated.)

loadzone tells b10-auth to load or reload a zone file. The arguments include: class which optionally defines the class (it defaults to IN); origin is the domain name of the zone; and datasrc optionally defines the type of datasource (it defaults to memory).
In this development version, currently this only supports the IN class and the memory data source.
getstats tells b10-auth to send its statistics data.
shutdown exits b10-auth. This has an optional pid argument to select the process ID to stop. (Note that the b10-init process may restart this service if configured.)

start_ddns_forwarder starts (or restarts) the internal forwarding of DDNS Update messages. This is used by the b10-ddns8 daemon to tell b10-auth that DDNS Update messages can be forwarded. This is not expected to be called by administrators; it will be removed as a public command in the future.

stop_ddns_forwarder stops the internal forwarding of DDNS Update messages. This is used by the b10-ddns8 daemon to tell b10-auth that DDNS Update messages should not be forwarded. This is not expected to be called by administrators; it will be removed as a public command in the future.

refsect1.title: STATISTICS DATA
refsect1.para: The statistics data collected by the b10-stats daemon for Auth include:

listitem.simpara: Number of IPv4 requests received by the b10-auth server.
Number of IPv6 requests received by the b10-auth server.
Number of requests with EDNS0 received by the b10-auth server.
Number of requests with unsupported EDNS version received by the b10-auth server.
Number of requests with TSIG received by the b10-auth server.
Number of requests with SIG(0) received by the b10-auth server; currently not implemented in BIND 10.
Number of requests with invalid TSIG or SIG(0) signature received by the b10-auth server.
Number of UDP requests received by the b10-auth server.
Number of TCP requests received by the b10-auth server.
Number of requests with "DNSSEC OK" (DO) bit was set received by the b10-auth server.
Number of OpCode=Query requests received by the b10-auth server.
Number of OpCode=IQuery requests received by the b10-auth server.
Number of OpCode=Status requests received by the b10-auth server.
Number of OpCode=Notify requests received by the b10-auth server.
Number of OpCode=Update requests received by the b10-auth server.
Number of requests in other OpCode received by the b10-auth server.
Number of responses sent by the b10-auth server.
Number of truncated responses sent by the b10-auth server.
Number of responses with EDNS0 sent by the b10-auth server.
Number of responses with TSIG sent by the b10-auth server.
Number of responses with SIG(0) sent by the b10-auth server; currently not implemented in BIND 10.
Number of queries received by the b10-auth server resulted in rcode = NoError and the number of answer RR >= 1.
Number of queries received by the b10-auth server resulted in authoritative answer.
Number of queries received by the b10-auth server resulted in non-authoritative answer.
Number of queries received by the b10-auth server resulted in referral answer.
Number of queries received by the b10-auth server resulted in NoError and AA bit is set in the response, but the number of answer RR == 0.
Number of authoritative queries rejected by the b10-auth server.
Number of requests received by the b10-auth server resulted in RCODE = 0 (NoError).
Number of requests received by the b10-auth server resulted in RCODE = 1 (FormErr).
Number of requests received by the b10-auth server resulted in RCODE = 2 (ServFail).
Number of requests received by the b10-auth server resulted in RCODE = 3 (NXDomain).
Number of requests received by the b10-auth server resulted in RCODE = 4 (NotImp).
Number of requests received by the b10-auth server resulted in RCODE = 5 (Refused).
Number of requests received by the b10-auth server resulted in RCODE = 6 (YXDomain).
Number of requests received by the b10-auth server resulted in RCODE = 7 (YXRRSet).
Number of requests received by the b10-auth server resulted in RCODE = 8 (NXRRSet).
Number of requests received by the b10-auth server resulted in RCODE = 9 (NotAuth).
Number of requests received by the b10-auth server resulted in RCODE = 10 (NotZone).
Number of requests received by the b10-auth server resulted in RCODE = 16 (BADVERS).
Number of requests received by the b10-auth server resulted in other RCODEs.

note.para:
Opcode of a request message will not be counted if:
The request message is too short to parse the message header
The request message is a response (i.e. QR bit is set)

Request attributes except for opcode will not be counted if TSIG validation failed as they are not reliable. We always count opcode mainly for compatibility with BIND 9, but remember that if there's any error related to TSIG, some of the counted opcode may not be trustworthy.

refsect1.title: FILES
refsect1.para: /usr/local/var/bind10/zone.sqlite3 — Location for the SQLite3 zone database when database_file configuration is not defined.
